xxl.core.util
Class LongIdGenerator

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.LongIdGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Convertable
public class LongIdGenerator
extends Object
implements Convertable

Handles identifyers which can be used for a lot of reasons. This class always stores the minimum and maximum values which were previously returned as identifyers.
There are two ways to obtain an identifyer. The first and most efficient one returns a new identifyer by looking at the statistics and returns a new smaller or greater identifyer than the current smallest/greatest value. If this method returns Long.MIN_VALUE, then no identifyer could be returned with this method. Then, the user has to call the second getIdentifyer method which needs a Function that returns an Iterator. This iterator has to contain all valid and used identifyers. If this method also is not able to return an identifyer, it returns Long.MIN_VALUE.
When identifyers are no longer used, then it can be useful to call the removeIdentifyer method.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

LongIdGenerator

public LongIdGenerator(long absoluteMin,
                       long absoluteMax)
Allocates a LongIdGenerator with the maximal interval possible. Both values have to be inside the interval [Long.MIN_VALUE+1, Long.MAX_VALUE-1] with absoluteMax>=absoluteMin.

Parameters:
absoluteMin - minimal id value possible.
absoluteMax - maximal id value possible.

LongIdGenerator

public LongIdGenerator()
Allocates a LongIdGenerator with the maximal interval possible.

Method Detail

reset

public void reset()
Resets the current IDs, so that new IDs can be generated.

makeExternalReservation

public void makeExternalReservation(long id)
If a method from the outside has knowledge of the id generator, then this external method can make a reservation on its own. Then, this method has to inform the generator by calling makeExternalReservation. So, the generator can stay in a consistent state.

Parameters:
id - identifyer which is reserved from the outside. The identifyer is not checked to be unique.

getDirectIdentifyer

public long getDirectIdentifyer()
Returns an identifyer only if the new identifyer can easily be generated.

Returns:
the identifyer or Long.MIN_VALUE if no identifyer can easily be generated. Then, call getIdentifyer.

getIdentifyer

public long getIdentifyer(Function getIdIterator)
Determines a free numerical identifyer. This class works with iterators of type java.lang.Number (Byte, Short, Integer, Long, ...).

Parameters:
getIdIterator - Function which returns an Iterator which then contains all Number values of valid and used identifyers.
Returns:
a free id (or Long.MIN_VALUE if no id is availlable).

removeIdentifyer

public void removeIdentifyer(long id)
Returns an identifyer to the generator. This can sometimes save some time to generate new ones (if minimum and maximum values are returned). This method does not have to be called. So, it is not possible to say how many ids are really out there.

Parameters:
id - identifyer which is no longer needed.
